page.title: 08ABBEY FIELDS and the POOL.
page.content: THE SWIMMING POOL and ABBEY FIELDS. The{Abbey Fields}form the{focal point of the{town}and was a{gift to the {townspeople}long ago.{A condition}of the{bequest}was that{the Fields should {remain unspoilt}for the pleasure and recreation of the town residents. In the{1920's}an{outdoor swimming pool was built in the{centre of the fields. {The pool}has been in{constant use}ever since.{Recently plans}have been {approved}to{change}the{character}of the pool by{enlarging the area {slightly, reducing the size of the {outdoor pool}to{enable}the {construction}of an{all-year-round {indoor pool}and to{landscape}the{whole {complex}in a{more attractive}and {modern manner.}Much{controversy}has surrounded{the project}but it is to{go {ahead}and should be{open in 1986.
